Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Type
 

Enumeration values:
TYPE_ONE  The user must choose exactly one item.

TYPE_ONE_OR_NONE  The user must choose one item or no item at all.

TYPE_MANY  The user may choose an arbitrary number of items.

Definition at line 362 of file TreeField.h.

TreeField (   ) 
 

Member Function Documentation

void addHotKey (  char  hotKey  )  [protected, inherited]
 

Adds a hot key for this field.

Note that the Field class provides a method to set a field's text. This method also calls addHotKeys(), so in this case, you don't need to.

Parameters:
hotKey The hot key character to be set.
See also:
setText()

void appendListener (  Listener *  listener  )  [inherited]
 

Adds a listener at the end of the listeners of this listenable object.

Appended listeners are called last.

Parameters:
listener The listener to be added.
Warning:
Listeners are auto-deleting when they are not listening to any listenable object anymore. So you should not hold any references to them and you should not manually delete them.

void appendRoot (  Item *  Root  ) 
 

Note:
After the call, the memory is owned by this object. You should not delete it, it will be done automatically.

void appendWidget (  Widget *  widget  )  [inherited]
 

Adds a component widget at the end of the widgets of this component.

Appended widgets are considered last.

Parameters:
widget The widget to be added.
Note:
Widgets may only be added to one component at a time.

After the call, the memory is owned by this object. You should not delete it, it will be done automatically.

void attachToCheckBox (  CheckBox *  checkBox,
bool  focus = false
)  [inherited]
 

Attaches the active state of this field to the checked state of a given check box.

The active state is automatically set to true, if and only if all check and radio box attachees are checked.

Parameters:
checkBox The check box to listen to.
focus Whether to set the focus to the field when the check box gets checked.

void attachToRadioBox (  RadioBox *  radioBox,
bool  focus = false
)  [inherited]
 

Attaches the active state of this field to the checked state of a given radio box.

The active state is automatically set to true, if and only if all check and radio box attachees are checked.

Parameters:
radioBox The radio box to listen to.
focus Whether to set the focus to the field when the radio box gets checked.

This method is useful before added new effects.

virtual bool consumingEnter (   )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Returns whether the ENTER key is entirely consumed by this input field.

If not, it may press the field area's default button. Defaults to false.

Returns:
Whether the ENTER key is entirely consumed by this input field.

Reimplemented in Button, and TextField.

void deleteChild (  Component *  child  )  [protected, inherited]
 

Destroys a component, if it is a child of this component.

If not (which is illegal), an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
child The child to be destroyed.

virtual void destroy (   )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Removes the component from the Glaziery system to destroy it.

First performs operations before the component is destroyed, then adds it to the Desktop's list of disposables.

Note:
The component is added to the list of disposable components. Nevertheless, the memory is still available until the next call to Desktop::draw() (the next frame).

This is an ungraceful removal, without user interaction and close notifications, but with destroy noficiation. E.g. for windows, use Window::close() to close normally.

Reimplemented from Component.

Detaches from a previously attached to check box.

See also:
attachToCheckBox()

void detachFromRadioBox (  RadioBox *  radioBox  )  [inherited]
 

Detaches from a previously attached to radio box.

See also:
attachToRadioBox()

Draws the component to the display surface.

This is usually achieved by delegating to the current skin.

Parameters:
context The drawing context that specifies the surface and clipping rectangle for the drawing operation.
Note:
The caller is responsible for not calling this method if the component is invisible.
See also:
Desktop::getSkin()

Reimplemented from Component.

virtual void drawContent (  DrawingContext &  context  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Draws the content of the scrolling field to the display surface.

This is usually achieved by delegating to the current skin.

Parameters:
context The drawing context that specifies the surface and clipping rectangle for the drawing operation. This context is already translated for the current scroll position and scroll field size, so you should draw as if there is no scrolling field, and use the field size you also return in getContentSize().

void ensureFocusVisible (  bool  deeply = false  ) 
 

Ensure that the focus is entirely visible by setting the scroll position.

If the focus cannot be shown entirely, then the top-left corner is ensured to be shown.

Parameters:
deeply Whether to try to show the expanded children, too.

If the focus cannot be shown entirely, then the top-left corner is ensured to be shown.

Parameters:
deeply Whether to try to show the expanded children, too.

virtual void ensureVisible (  Vector  topLeft,
Vector  bottomRight
)  [virtual, inherited]
 

Adjusts the scroll position so that a given rectangle within the content is entirely visible.

The method tries to do as least scrolling as possible. If the rectangle is larger than the content view of the scrolling field, only the top-left part of the rectangle will be visible.

virtual void ensureVisible (  Vector  point  )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Adjusts the scroll position so that a given point within the content is visible.

The method tries to do as least scrolling as possible.

virtual void ensureVisibleNow (  Vector  topLeft,
Vector  bottomRight
)  [virtual, inherited]
 

Adjusts the scroll position so that a given rectangle within the content is entirely visible now, bypassing the skin.

The method tries to do as least scrolling as possible. If the rectangle is larger than the content view of the scrolling field, only the top-left part of the rectangle will be visible.

Note:
Use this method in the skin to set the position directly.

Vector getBorderSize (   )  [inherited]
 

The size of the border to be displayed around the content view.

(0, 0) does not display any border at all, (1, 1) displays a simple border. Defaults to (1, 1), suitable for most field areas. The SingleFieldArea and the ListField's RowsField automatically set this property to (0, 0).

Returns:
The size of the border or (0, 0), if the border is disabled.

Returns:
The children origin.

Returns:
The client area.

virtual EventTarget* getContentEventTargetAt (  Vector  position  )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Returns the event target at a given position within the content that is setup to receive pointer events.
.

This is a deep search: The desktop delegates to the found window or popup component, which delegates to the client area and so on.

Parameters:
position The position relative to the content's upper-left corner.
Returns:
The event receiving event target at the position or NULL, if there is no target.

Vector getContentSize (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns the size of the content, as if there was no scrolling field and the field must display its entire content at once.

The scrolling field automatically adjusts the scrollers according to this value.

Note:
The value is updated by the updateContentSize() method. It should be called when the content changes in a way that might change the its size.
Returns:
The size of the content.
See also:
updateContentSize()

the scrolling field's size without the scrolling field border and scrollers. The content view size is the visible area of the content.

Returns:
The size of the content view.

Vector getEffectiveInnerPaddingSize (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns the size of the padding space at the bottom-right corner of the content view.

If a scroller exists, this is the inner padding space, otherwise, it is the outer padding space. Defaults to (1, 1).

Returns:
The size of the effective inner padding space.
See also:

virtual EventTarget* getEventTargetAt (  Vector  position  )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Returns the event target at a given position that is setup to receive pointer events.

For popup components, this is always true, for windows, this is true if and only if the pointer event mode is active or inactive, but bypassing windows are treated as not existing (transparent for events), and for widgets, this depends on the widget's hit test (isHitAt()).

This is a deep search: The desktop delegates to the found window or popup component, which delegates to the client area and so on.

Parameters:
position The position relative to the event target's origin. For components, this is their absolute position, for widgets, this is the absolute position of their component.
Returns:
The event receiving event target at the position or NULL, if there is no target.

Reimplemented from Component.

const ArrayList<Int>& getFocusItemPath (   ) 
 

Returns a list of 0-indexed positions of the item that currently has focus.

The first index is the position within the root items list, the second index is the position within the root's child items list, and so on, until the focus item is reached.
If the list is empty, then no item has currently focus.

Returns:
The focus item positions.

SkinData* getSkinData (   )  [inherited]
 

Returns the skin specific settings and other skin data.

The skin data is managed by the skin. If you want to implement a skin independent application (or game), do not use this object outside the skin. However, if you know which skin is in use and you require to read or write special property, you may cast this object to the respective type. This object may be NULL, if the skin does not need to store any data.

Returns:
The skin specific settings and other skin data.
Note:
If the object is not null when the component is destroyed, then the skin data is automatically destroyed.

virtual String getText (   )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Returns the text (the caption) of this field, if the field supports it.

For multi line text fields, the string is joined using new line characters ('
'). If supported by the field implementation, the text may contain a hot key character (preceded by an ampersand character). Pressing the hot key will set the focus to the field. An ampersand character indicates a hot key, a double ampersand print the ampersand character itself.

Returns:
The text (the caption) of this field.
Note:
This method uses the attribute returned by the getTextAttribute() method. If getTextAttribute() returns NULL, the field does not support text editing. setText does nothing, getText returns an empty string in this case.
See also:
getTextAttribute()

Reimplemented in TextField.

virtual String* getTextAttribute (   )  [protected, virtual, inherited]
 

Returns the text string attribute, if the field supports text editing, otherwise NULL.

Defaults to NULL, override in derivatives that support text editing.

Note:
getTextAttribute() returns NULL, the field does not support text editing. setText does nothing, getText returns an empty string in this case.
Returns:
The text string attribute or NULL.
See also:
getText()

setText()

Reimplemented in Button, CheckBox, GroupField, Label, and RadioBox.

virtual void hide (   )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Hides the component (makes it invisible, but still existent).

Reimplemented from Component.

void hideDeferred (   )  [inherited]
 

Defers the hide operation, executing it by the main thread.

Note:
Glaziery is not thread-safe in the most part of it. All glaziery objects (including windows, fields, etc.) may not be accessed by any other thread than the main thread. Concurrent threads created using the platform adapter's createThread method must therefore place operations on Glaziery objects into a deferral queue. Use this method from any concurrent thread.
See also:
Desktop::deferOperation()

void insertListener (  int  position,
Listener *  listener
)  [inherited]
 

Inserts a listener at a given position in the listeners of this listenable object.

Parameters:
position The 0-indexed position of the listener.
listener The listener to be added.
Warning:
Listeners are auto-deleting when they are not listening to any listenable object anymore. So you should not hold any references to them and you should not manually delete them.

void insertRoot (  int  position,
Item *  root
) 
 

Note:
After the call, the memory is owned by this object. You should not delete it, it will be done automatically.

virtual bool moveInternal (  Vector  position,
bool  notifyParent
)  [protected, virtual, inherited]
 

Moves the component within its parent and handles listeners.

This method is called internally by the move overload, and by parents moveing a child.

Parameters:
position The new position relative to its parent.
notifyParent false, if the method has been called from the parent (e.g. onChildMoved() or onChildResized()). In this case, the child event handlers are not called again, to prevent an endless recursion or other inappropriate behavior.
Returns:
Whether the component was actually moved.
See also:

virtual bool onAnyKey (  bool  option1,

)  [virtual, inherited]
 

Handles the event that any key event occurred.

This method is called in addition to another key method, such as onCharacter or onMoveDown. The onAnyKey method is called first.

Parameters:
option1 Whether the option button 1 is currently pressed, e.g. on Windows systems, this is the SHIFT key.
option2 Whether the option button 2 is currently pressed, e.g. on Windows systems, this is the CTRL key.
Returns:
Whether the event target has consumed the event. If false, the event is first passed to the desktop and then to the input manager to increase event quantities.

Reimplemented from EventTarget.

Reimplemented in Dialog.

virtual long onContentHold (  Vector  position,
long  holdTime
)  [virtual, inherited]
 

Handles the event that, after the event target is pressed down on the content (usually using the left mouse button), the pointer is not moved, but the button has not yet been released.

onContentHold() is called in the time between onContentPress() and onContentRelease(). Glaziery provides the time between the last call of onContentHold() and this one. It expects that the onHold implementation issues in its return value the hold time not consumed. If 0 is returned, all the time has been consumed and the holdTime reflects only the time between two consecutive onContentHold() calls each time. If a positive value is returned, this value is added to the next holdTime value. This helps to implement operations that have to be performed after some time has elapsed, while not losing remaining milli seconds. The following code snippet illustrates this operation: 


 long MyClass::onContentHold(Vector position, long holdTime)
 {
 	while (holdTime >= 100)
 	{
 		performSomeOperation();
 		holdTime -= 100;
 	}
 	return holdTime;
 }
Parameters:
position The current position of the pointer within the content, relative to the upper-left corner of the content.
holdTime The hold time between the last call of onContentHold() and this one, plus the hold time not consumed in the last call of onContentHold(). The time's unit is milli seconds.
Returns:
The hold time this method has not consumed in milli seconds.
See also:
onContentPress()

onContentRelease()

Reimplemented in TextField.

virtual void onContentPress (  Vector  position,
bool  option1,
bool  option2
)  [virtual, inherited]

virtual DraggingSurrogate* onDragStart (  const Vector &  startPosition  )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Handles the event that a dragging operation started.

This is when the component was pressed using the primary pointer button and then the pointer has been moved a little.

Parameters:
startPosition The absolute position where the dragging started.
Returns:
The dragging surrogate to be drawn next to the pointer while the dragging operation is running. This surrogate is a representative of the dragged object (event target, list field row, etc.). NULL indicates that dragging is not supported, which is the default. The DraggingSurrogate class itself can be used to support dragging without drawing a different pointer etc.

virtual long onHold (  Vector  position,
long  holdTime
)  [virtual, inherited]
 

Handles the event that, after the event target is pressed down (usually using the left mouse button), the pointer is not moved, but the button has not yet been released.

onHold() is called in the time between onPress() and onRelease(). Glaziery provides the time between the last call of onHold() and this one. It expects that the onHold implementation issues in its return value the hold time not consumed. If 0 is returned, all the time has been consumed and the holdTime reflects only the time between two consecutive onHold() calls each time. If a positive value is returned, this value is added to the next holdTime value. This helps to implement operations that have to be performed after some time has elapsed, while not losing remaining milli seconds. The following code snippet illustrates this operation: 


 long MyClass::onHold(Vector position, long holdTime)
 {
 	while (holdTime >= 100)
 	{
 		performSomeOperation();
 		holdTime -= 100;
 	}
 	return holdTime;
 }
Parameters:
position The current position of the pointer relative to the upper-left corner of the event target's origin. For components, this is their absolute position, for widgets, this is the absolute position of their component.
holdTime The hold time between the last call of onHold() and this one, plus the hold time not consumed in the last call of onHold(). The time's unit is milli seconds.
Returns:
The hold time this method has not consumed in milli seconds.
See also:
onPress()

onRelease()

Reimplemented from EventTarget.

void prependListener (  Listener *  listener  )  [inherited]
 

Adds a listener at the beginning of the listeners of this listenable object.

Prepended listeners are called first.

Parameters:
listener The listener to be added.
Warning:
Listeners are auto-deleting when they are not listening to any listenable object anymore. So you should not hold any references to them and you should not manually delete them.

void prependRoot (  Item *  Root  ) 
 

Note:
After the call, the memory is owned by this object. You should not delete it, it will be done automatically.

void prependWidget (  Widget *  widget  )  [inherited]
 

Adds a component widget at the beginning of the widgets of this component.

Prepended widgets are considered first.

Parameters:
widget The widget to be added.
Note:
Widgets may only be added to one component at a time.

After the call, the memory is owned by this object. You should not delete it, it will be done automatically.

void removeHotKey (  unsigned char  hotKey  )  [protected, inherited]
 

Removes a hot key from this field.

Use this method when implementing a field that has a hot key text, e.g. a check box, and call it when deleting the object. Note that the Field class provides a method to set a field's text. This method also calls removeHotKey(), so in this case, you don't need to.

Parameters:
hotKey The hot key character to be removed. It is safe to provide 0: In this case, the method does nothing.

void removeListener (  Listener *  listener  )  [inherited]
 

Removes a listener from the list of listeners and then deletes it, if it is no longer used.

Parameters:
listener The listener to be removed and deleted.
Warning:
Listeners are auto-deleting when they are not listening to any listenable object anymore. So you should not hold any references to them.

void removeRoot (  int  position  ) 
 

void removeRoots (   ) 
 

void removeWidget (  Widget *  widget  )  [inherited]
 

Removes a widget from the list of component widgets and then deletes it.

Parameters:
widget The widget to be removed and deleted.

bool resize (  Vector  size  )  [inherited]
 

Resizes the component.

This calls the listeners' onResized() method.

Parameters:
size The new size.
Returns:
Whether the component was actually resized.
Note:
Calling this method on fields or field areas relayouts the fields area, if automatic layouting is enabled, so consider turning it off while doing major changes to the fields of such fields area.

void resizeComponent (  Component *  relatedComponent,
Vector  size
)  [protected, inherited]
 

Resizes a related component (child, parent, ...).

No veto is possible, and the parent is not notified.

Parameters:
relatedComponent The related component to be resized.
size The new size.
Note:
Use this method only from within components that have to move related components. This method delegates to the moveInternal() method.
See also:
resize()

resizeInternal()

virtual bool resizeInternal (  Vector  size,
bool  notifyParent
)  [protected, virtual, inherited]
 

Resizes the component and handles listeners.

This method is called internally by the resize overload, and by parents resizing a child.

Parameters:
size The new size.
notifyParent false, if the method has been called from the parent (e.g. onChildMoved() or onChildResized()). In this case, the child event handlers are not called again, to prevent an endless recursion or other inappropriate behavior.
Returns:
Whether the component was actually resized.

void scroll (  Vector  delta  )  [inherited]
 

Translates the current scroll position by a given delta (adds it to the current value.

The scroll position is the position of the content to be displayed in the upper-left corner of the scrolling field. The method automatically constraints the position within the valid range.

Parameters:
delta The delta to be scrolled.

void setBorderSize (  Vector  borderSize  )  [inherited]
 

The size of the border to be displayed around the content view.

(0, 0) does not display any border at all, (1, 1) displays a simple border. Defaults to (1, 1), suitable for most field areas. The SingleFieldArea and the ListField's RowsField automatically set this property to (0, 0).

Parameters:
borderSize The size of the border or (0, 0), to disable the botder.

void setModel (  void *  model,
void(*  modelDestructor)(void *model) = NULL
)  [inherited]
 

Sets the application (or game) defined data.

Typically, there is an object that contains application data that corresponds to this graphical element. This object (or raw data) is stored here. Glaziery will not perform any operation on it, but you can use it to identify application objects for given event targets (such as components).

Parameters:
model The application (or game) defined data.
modelDestructor An optional static method that is called, whenever the glaziery object is destroyed or when a new model is set. Specify this function only, if the model must be destroyed by this glaziery object, i.e. the object "owns" the model. If the model is a glaziery object itself, you may use the GlazieryObject::destructor() function.
See also:
destructor()

virtual void setSkinData (  SkinData *  skinData  )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Sets the skin specific settings and other skin data.

The skin data is managed by the skin. If you want to implement a skin independent application (or game), do not use this object outside the skin. However, if you know which skin is in use and you require to read or write special property, you may cast this object to the respective type. This object may be NULL, if the skin does not need to store any data.

Parameters:
skinData The skin specific settings and other skin data.
Note:
If the object is not null when the component is destroyed, then the skin data is automatically destroyed.

Any previously set skin data is automatically destroyed.

Reimplemented from GlazieryObject.

virtual void setText (  const String &  text  )  [virtual, inherited]
 

Sets the text (the caption) of this field, if the field supports it.

For multi line text fields, the string is split at new line characters ('
'). If supported by the field implementation, the text may contain a hot key character (preceded by an ampersand character). Pressing the hot key will set the focus to the field. An ampersand character indicates a hot key, a double ampersand print the ampersand character itself.

Parameters:
text The text (the caption) of this field.
Note:
This method uses the attribute returned by the getTextAttribute() method. If getTextAttribute() returns NULL, the field does not support text editing. setText does nothing, getText returns an empty string in this case.
See also:
getTextAttribute()

Reimplemented in Button, CheckBox, Label, RadioBox, and TextField.

void setTextDeferred (  const String &  text  )  [inherited]
 

Defers the setText operation, executing it by the main thread.

Note:
Glaziery is not thread-safe in the most part of it. All glaziery objects (including windows, fields, etc.) may not be accessed by any other thread than the main thread. Concurrent threads created using the platform adapter's createThread method must therefore place operations on Glaziery objects into a deferral queue. Use this method from any concurrent thread.
Parameters:
text The text (the caption) of this field. An ampersand character indicates a hot key, a double ampersand print the ampersand character itself.
See also:
Desktop::deferOperation()

void tutorialClick (  PointerEffect::ButtonEffect  buttonEffect = PointerEffect::BUTTONEFFECT_LEFTCLICK,
bool  option1 = false,
bool  option2 = false,
long  time = -1
)  [inherited]
 

For tutorials: Creates a pointer effect that moves the pointer to this component and clicks the component, and waits until the effect has ended.

Parameters:
buttonEffect The button effect (see PointerEffect::ButtonEffect) to be added (clicking, double-clicking, right-clicking the component). Only BUTTONEFFECT_LEFTCLICK, BUTTONEFFECT_DOUBLECLICK, and BUTTONEFFECT_RIGHTCLICK is allowed. To drag this component, use tutorialDragDropTo. Defaults to BUTTONEFFECT_LEFTCLICK;
option1 Whether option1 (e.g. Shift) is held during the button effect. Defaults to false.
option2 Whether option2 (e.g. Ctrl) is held during the button effect. Defaults to false.
time The time in milli seconds for the effect, or leave empty for a default.
Returns:
The newly created tutorial effect.
Note:
Use this method in Tutorial::run() implementations only.
See also:

virtual void updateContentSize (   )  [virtual]
 

Calculates the size of the content, as if there was no scrolling field and the field must display its entire content at once, and puts the value into the contentSize attributes.

The scrolling field automatically adjusts the scrollers according to this value.

Note:
This method should be called when the content changes in a way that might change the its size.

Definition at line 70 of file Field.h.

ArrayList<Int> focusItemPath [private]
 

A list of 0-indexed positions of the item that currently has focus.

The first index is the position within the root items list, the second index is the position within the root's child items list, and so on, until the focus item is reached.
If the list is empty, then no item has currently focus.

Definition at line 72 of file Field.h.

ArrayList<Int> rangeStartItemPath [private]
 

A list of 0-indexed positions of the item where the range selection starts.

The first index is the position within the root items list, the second index is the position within the root's child items list, and so on, until the range selection start item is reached.
If the list is empty, then no range exists.
